title: What are the best earbud headphones under $200 for listening to music? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are curious about the refreshing and mesmerizing design of Panasonic RZ-S500W wait till you hear what these can do. Now a day’s exercise is a demanding activity, sports, walk and run these are best fit in every condition. In addition to the premium audio that Panasonic is famous for, these earbuds are packed with evolved noise cancelling functionality, supreme microphone system, and natural touch controls. As a result, you can hear and be heard like never before. Panasonic RZ-S500W can be regularly picked up for a price of $179.99 but you can catch it by using the coupon code from CatchPromos with discounted price of $149.99.  From the best selection of earbuds for your needs can be a challenge. From the hierarchy of earbuds, there's so much to choose from. The best earbuds of 2020 period all of these different form factors – the style you should go for is completely down to your needs. If you are looking for best earbuds having noise cancelling quality and mesmerizing design then JABRA ELITE ACTIVE 65t is fit for your choice. We’re all different; from our taste in music, to the shape of our ears. JABRA ELITE ACTIVE 65t set out to create a pair of tiny true wireless buds that would deliver on everything you’d expect; great calls, amazing music quality and customizable features, which can be purchased for as low from the market for just $139.99 you have to put the coupon to avail the discount of $30 from each pair.  Sometime you have no time for the selection of what you actually need with your budget range here is another pair of earbuds with high quality sound then JBL LIVE 300TWS - Premium True Wireless Headphone with variety of colors is best for you. True wireless earbuds: JBL LIVE 300TWS Bluetooth headphones are totally wireless, with nothing to hold you back or tie you down. This brand JBL LIVE 300TWS is in your best range catches it up with only $119  Just Google - Catch Headphones Promos - and find many more headphones deals and earbuds on sale now.

If you prefer clarity and detail, the Ultimate Ears TripleFi 10 can be regularly picked up for a price less than $200 (retail price: $400). They are triple balanced armature driver in-ear monitors which has a driver each for bass, mids and treble.  I picked up a brand new pair for about $130 recently. While fit is an issue for some TF10 owners (the housing is pretty large), and mids with the stock cable aren't exactly the best, the issue can be easily remediated by use of an after market cable which can be purchased for as low as $40. Another pair worth considering in your budget is the Phaiton PS 200 ($200) which scores exceptionally in all departments and has a very pleasing sound signature.  Some other earphones you might also want to look into are Fischer Audio DBA-02 ($160, but availability is a bit of an issue), Sunrise SW Xcape ($80, again availability is an issue) and MEElectronics CC51 ($80) which offer fantastic value for money. I would ONLY recommend Etymotics if you like absolutely flat response, analytical earphones. They don't make for fun listening at all, but do offer very accurate reproduction of sound. Head-fi, the audiophile community has a fantastic thread summarizing the IEMs mentioned above:http://www.head-fi.org/forum/thread/478568/
